Comments_List: I learned how to analyze a film below the initial layer. To better understand how themes and narrative elements fit into a film.

I learnt a lot about sporting culture and different types of sports played all across the world. And how the media plays an integral role in portraying an image of any famous sports personalities. Through the Screenings I learnt about the life story of some of the Greatest sports players all around the world.
I discovered, in this class, that I had a much greater interest in film studies than I had anticipated.

Strengths is a lot of freedom to discuss material. Professor Musser was super open to meeting with me and helpful.

Weakenesses is course was sometimes too unstructured. Would've been better to have group work and group activities to engage in debates and discussions instead of just the same format every class.
Yes. interesting to learn and study films which is different than any other course I've taken.
Yes I would, as it greatly improves your knowledge and experience about sports. I learnt about players and watched movies which i had never heard of before till i attended this course.
Of course, one of the most informative classes for a student with my interests at Yale.
